title: Make publisher dropdowns scrollable within modals (max height 250px)

requirements.text:
Update the Publisher dropdown menus in the following modals so the dropdown list is scrollable with a maximum height of 250px, shows a scrollbar when the list exceeds that height, and stays visually contained within the modal/viewport (i.e., does not extend beyond the modal or off-screen):
- Add Pioneer modal on the Pioneers page (frontend/src/components/pioneers/AddPioneerModal.tsx)
- Record Visit modal on the Shepherding page (frontend/src/components/shepherding/RecordVisitModal.tsx)
- Add Conductor modal on the Service Meeting Conductors page (frontend/src/components/conductors/ConductorModal.tsx)
- Add Trained Publisher modal on the Public Witnessing page (frontend/src/components/publicWitnessing/TrainedPublisherModal.tsx)

Keep all other behavior, styling, validation, and text unchanged.

quotes:
Update the publisher dropdown menus in four specific modals to support scrolling:

1. Add Pioneer modal on the Pioneers page - make the publisher dropdown scrollable.

2. Record Visit modal on the Shepherding page - make the publisher dropdown scrollable.

3. Add Conductor modal on the Service Meeting Conductors page - make the publisher dropdown scrollable.

4. Add Trained Publisher modal on the Public Witnessing page - make the publisher dropdown scrollable.

For each dropdown:
- Set a maximum height of 250 pixels
- Add a scrollbar when there are more publishers than fit in that height
- Make sure the dropdown stays inside the modal and doesn't extend beyond the screen

Keep everything else unchanged.

acceptanceCriteria: In each of the four specified modals, the Publisher dropdown list has a maximum height of 250px.
When the Publisher list exceeds 250px in height, the dropdown list becomes vertically scrollable and a scrollbar is available.
When opened near the bottom/top of the modal/viewport, the dropdown list repositions and/or constrains itself so it does not render off-screen and does not visually escape the modal experience.
No other fields, dropdowns (e.g., service year, status), form validation, submission behavior, or user-facing text is changed.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only / immutable UI component sources). Achieve the behavior by adjusting how the existing Select/SelectContent components are used in the four specified modal components.
No backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Custom scrollbar styling beyond ensuring a scrollbar appears when needed.
Changing option ordering, filtering logic, or which publishers appear in the lists.
Modifying modal sizes/layouts beyond what is necessary to keep the dropdown contained and scrollable.
